description:
When it comes to bagels, these donut shaped breads are just plain nothing without a shmear.  At work, I had half a bagel painted with cream cheese, and I finished it in at least ten minutes rather than eating it without a cream cheese.  Later on, someone came and bought Noah's best bagels, and they looked a bit richer.  I like the one with blueberries; they're perfect for breakfast just like the muffin.  I thought I cut any of Noah's bagel in half neatly, but I nearly destroyed it.  It would be nice to buy me a special bagel slicer, so I can guillotine the bagel. :-}

My first purchase in Noah's Bagel is the Hummus Veg-out and I get to have a fruit cup with it followed by a long slice of pickle.  It's too bad Noah's never had any type of bagel that's gluten free, so I'm OK with a multigrain instead.  When I quickly head back home this afternoon, I thought I give my mom my other half of the bagel sandwich.  We both find my bagel sandwich tasty and satisfying.  I should've asked the staff to hold the onions since the taste of it is strong, but that's nothing I can't handle.  I'll be glad back once more to go for what I like to purchase.
author: Jimmy C.

description:
Also no manager response after all this time is pretty telling. Congratulations Noah's bagels. May as well be a McDonald's. 
  

To think my company used to pay they easily 1k every conference just for bagel delivery. Makes you think
author: David G.

description:
If you search for "Noah's" you will see 5 locations in SF and every single one is 2.5 stars.  Like a good bagel, at least that's consistent.  

This one is the only location in downtown and is always pretty busy - but despite the line, I rarely see any hustle.  The store is staffed for the morning rush, but the employees are not allocated correctly.  1 lady is wiping down and rearranging a half empty yogurt or smear case while there is barely 1 person taking orders and answering the phone.   The line is wrapped around outside and 2 people are working on orders but there is no queued up orders b/c the guy is on the phone.  *insert shaking my head emoji*.  Every morning.  But I still come here at least 1x a week.
author: Kathleen W.

description: I was in a rush and craving bread, so I decided that a bagel would hit the spot. Yes and no...the sesame bagel was still warm, so it was a plus that they were made fresh even at lunchtime, but it was slightly over cooked and tasted burnt. I also couldn't remember Noah's bagels being so fluffy, so I was a little disappointed about that, too, but I'm sure many other people would love them because of this. The staff were pleasant and provided quick service, so that was a plus at least.
author: Lori C.

description: Found Noah's New York Bagels in SF, while walking along the infamous Market Street.  This place was hopping!  Line up out the door.  That's usually not a bad sign.  I ordered a variety of bagels.  They had lots of choices and breakfast options.  The service was fast (a little abrupt, but typical for NYC).  The prices were very reasonable, especially for the quality and taste.  Best option that I've found for breakfast in SF, specifically near Financial District and Market St.
author: Kevin B.

description:
there was a time that this place had value.  now the bagels are just a rubbery piece of dough.  no taste, no texture (other then rubber), over priced.  

not worth the trip
author: Tim F.

description: I found Noah's to have good, solid bagels - with lots of variety.  There are at least a dozen different bagels to choose from.  If you like bagel sandwiches; there are about a dozen different breakfast sandwiches and a dozen different lunch sandwiches.  You can get anything ranging from really healthy to overly decadent.  The lines here are long in the morning - always - been here 20+ times - which should tell you that people keep frequenting the place.
author: Dave C.

description:
I just wanted a good bagel on my way to the SF office and this was in the perfect spot. They have "New York bagel" in their name, so they are setting the bar pretty high. As a former New Yorker, I intended to judge them based on that name...and I am happy to say that they did pretty well! The bagel was very good!
The only reason this didn't get 5 stars was the service. I was there on an average weekday morning and it was crowded...which shouldn't be a big surprise. The line was nearly out the door and it took a loooooong time to get served. I saw a few people get impatient and bail out. Not sure if this is the norm or if I just caught them on a bad day.
author: Dave W.

description:
I came here to pick up two bakers dozens for my office in the morning. It was a Friday, around 8:45, there was a line but barely and it moved quickly. I came in with a list on my phone of what flavors I wanted, and the lady was super patient as she got them all for me. They had run out of a few flavors, but I guess that's to be expected on a morning in FiDi. I was out pretty quickly.
The bagels are good enough, and a good value in SF. Do I still miss East Coast bagels? Yes. But were my coworkers happy? Yes. And it was ~$30 for 26 bagels and 4 tubs of cream cheese, so my bank account is happy too.
author: Max P.

description: Noah's Bagels has good bagels (particularly when they're toasted) and a good variety. At my office, it was always such a great surprise in the morning to come in and see that someone brought them in as a treat. That being said, the actual experience of going here was awful. After waiting at the register (for a while) to order, one of the staff shouted - actually shouted! - at another staff to serve us. I don't know the story behind that, but it seemed very unprofessional and disruptive. Anyway, my bf and I tried to order breakfast from the menu, only to find out (after ordering everything, but luckily before paying) that they ran out of eggs. Um... okay. That seems like a staple that shouldn't be out, especially since it wasn't that late in the day. They were also out of some of the deli meats. What was left? We don't really know since we didn't stick around to find out. Long story short, while the bagels are good, I'll likely patronize a different business instead the next time I want a bagel/breakfast, and only consider coming here for a quick in and out pickup.
author: Bianca C.

description:
This store is horribly mismanaged. At 9am on a Friday, their entire case of bagels is empty. Not a single bagel in site. For a Friday in downtown San Francisco, this should be prime time to ensure you have product. As a bagel store, you have zero value with no bagels. To make matters worse, they don't even bother to acknowledge the lack of bagels in any manner until you've waited ten minutes in line, get to the front, and THEN they tell you to come back later. 

There are dozens of bagel-only type shops in NYC, where all they sell all day long are bagels. I've never walked into one at any time of the day and seen no bagels.
author: Tay H.

description: Good bagels but dirty store. Espresso machine broken. Asked for no cheese on bagel but got it anyway. Dirty rag on the floor. Probably best to do take out. Bagel was delicious.
author: Lucy K.

description:
Is an excellent location, but they no longer brew fresh coffee into afternoon after 3. Staff is courteous. Fresh and tasty offerings. 
Runs crowded in the mornings, and dining space does not accommodate large number of patrons. Avoid on early weekend mornings. 
Has attached parking that is relatively convenient.
author: Trebla N.

description:
What a disappointment. I love Noah's but the one time I decide to go and buy a lox bagel from here it doesn't turn out amazing as how I'd hope. It was super busy at Noah's so the wait was quite long but I didn't really mind.  

Once we got our order, my colleague and I had to get back to work so we didn't think much of it. Once we arrived back to work, we realized that they forgot our potato salad and chips that went along with our order.  I let it go because they're human and it's normal for us to forget here and there. At least the service was nice. 

What really got me upset is how my lox bagel sandwich only had lox on one side. I was so confused because when I finished the first half, I was getting ready to eat the other half only to find one tiny piece of salmon sitting in my lox. I took a bite and my salmon was gone. It's really sad to see how inconsistent they are with their bagels. I really wanted to like this location specifically but I don't think I'll be back.
author: Anna D.

description: Came at 4 on a Tuesday. They ran out of plain bagels and only had wheat. Got two salmon bagels with cream cheese. Barely any salmon and barely any cream cheese. It's also more expensive than if you go somewhere else for the exact same bagel.
author: Angel L.

description:
I give up on this place. being from the east coast I understand bagels are different here, but this is just not a good experience regardless

I'm not sure when is the right time to be here, but each time I've come the bagels are stale. and the ordering process is stupid. one person takes the order, but then you move to a different person to pay. and there are way too many people waiting for their orders. maybe if the same person who took the order rang up the sale, there could be more people making the orders and the wait time wouldn't be so bad

anyway, I'll continue the search for a decent SF bagel, but won't be coming here anymore
author: Bob U.

description:
Good stuff first: Service is usually prompt. I've always ordered the Turkey Avocado Club and the tomato spread is fantastic. Today I got coleslaw on the side and it's not too soupy as coleslaw can often be.

What I don't like: This is the third time I've ordered the Turkey Avocado Club and they were out of the potato roll every time. I get it on the plain bagel instead, which tastes good, but definitely not the soft roll I was looking forward to.

I was wondering why my sandwich weighed ten pounds when I pulled out of the bag and LOOK how much turkey! I took half of it off to save for future bread I may stumble upon. The turkey-to-bacon ratio is just not something I want to mess around with.

Also, can you please take an extra moment to cut the sandwich all the way through?  I know the bagel is tougher than potato rolls so perhaps they should update their sandwich-cutting training courses to account for the perpetually-sold-out potato rolls. Sandwich exploded into ingredients when I attempted to rip it in half myself.
author: Jessika S.

description:
Blue eggs?!?

Picked up two egg sandwiches this morning. I got to work and opened mine thinking the bagel wasn't toasted enough to find BLUE smeared on the inside of the bagel. 
My boyfriend had left in the car and had then texted me that his also had blue all over the eggs. 

I went back a received a refund but no explanation. I did notice one of the workers has blue hair which is typically semi- permanent which means, I'm hoping to god, that it's from her touching her hair and then the eggs and not something worse since  my boyfriend ate most of his without realizing it.

... not to mention the service wasn't the friendliest.
author: Jenna C.

description: Had an albacore tuna sandwich with side of potato salad included for 6.99. A decent lunch in financial district and it took them about 4 minutes to prepare it and it was delicious. The line was short and I will definitely go back. The only problem was they spreaded the tuna unevenly on the bagela but I was ok with it.
author: Yasaman D.

description:
This post is mainly just for their bagels.

I come in every morning to purchase a bagel with a different type of shmear every morning for the last month or so and this lady always ring me up and the bagel comes out in a friendly manner.

I am not going to complain! This Noah's is right across the street from my office also so that's a plus.
author: Danny L.

description: Filled with incompetent and surely staff. Closed 7 hours early today because they don't know how to operate s cash register with cash only.
author: Adina P.

description: Never opens on time. Usually wind up at Starbucks who know what time it is. They seem to be busy filling office orders and don't have time for walk-ins. Gave up going since it was a little out of my way. The one time (out of 8) they opened near on time (5 minutes late) the sandwich was fine. Too bad.
author: Stuart W.

description:
I have walked by many times but was intimidated by the line. I didn't want to be the person who held the line up.
I finally decided to check it out and glad I did. I decided on the Santa Fe breakfast bagel on asiago and left so fulfilled. It's the perfect combination with the jalapeño spread! Yum. The works were kind with several questions I had, especially given that they were busy I appreciate how nice they were answering.
author: Danielle C.

description: I stood inside the store for 5 minutes and no one acknowledged my presence. The cashier was having a casual conversation with an over-staying customer. There were 2 other salespeople but there was no other customer. I felt ignored so I walked out. As I walked out, all of a sudden all 3 of them yelled, "Can I help you?" Bad customer service. The store doesn't even rate a one-star.
author: Reeto P.

description: Twenty minutes waiting for a bagel with cream cheese and the manager keeps taking cell calls. This is the most disorganized place I've been in a while.
author: Darth R.

description:
When I have my bagel cravings in the morning, Noah Bagels never fails, well because it is connected to my building office. Fast and easy.

I rarely come here because I find the bagels to be mediocre. Sometimes they are kind of hard and stale. Some of their bagel sandwiches are okay, nothing amazing but gets the job done. However, I will say the Nova Lox Sandwich IS BOMB. The only sandwich I get there these days. It has a generous amount of cream cheese and smoked salmon. It also comes with a choice of fresh fruit, chips or salad, comes together to be ~$7 something. So good deal! If you are looking for a quick breakfast, I recommend coming here.
author: Natalie L.

description: Bought a plain egg sandwich with cheese and received a soggy, chewy bagel with an egg that looks like it's moldy. Came back the next day and showed them this picture. Got a free bagel: mushroom, spinach & swiss. The bagel yet again was chewy and a little hard and the spinach was crunchy (other places I've ordered this same sandwich it is a little cooked). Then I go onto their yelp page and up popped a notice that this place has "poor food safety score" and saw all the surrounding Noah's Bagels have ratings of 2.5 or lower. Guess I won't be coming here anymore.
author: Anna N.

description: I came to Noah's as a recommendation from a friend. My first encounter was a woman who had to return to the store because her bagel sandwich was missing egg (it was just spinach and cheese). Then I experienced the staff yelling back at one another about the missing egg. I then ordered a bacon, egg, and cheddar sandwich and a small coffee. The coffee was ice cold and the bagel was stale. I won't be coming back.
author: Jessica W.

description:
Ordered butter on sourdough, got back to the office to find it covered in cream cheese, this comes after waiting for 15 minutes (for a bagel) 

This was the second try and it was a failure like the first attempt.

Even if it's busy your customers still expect what they ordered and paid for.
author: Shane S.

description: I rarely go to Noah's. I don't find them very good in general and they are WAY overpriced. I usually go to Lee's (if you work in San Francisco you know about Lee's).  Today a co-worker wanted to go to Noah's so I figured I'd give it another try since it's been probably a year or more since I've been. Bad decision.  Almost $7 for cold eggs, soggy bagel, forgot my tomato so they added it - yes great except it still had a big core in the middle and they sliced the bagel but not the tomato. Won't be going back. I will stick with Lee's thank you.  Oh we waited about 20-25 minutes for this lovely food.
author: Pam H.

description:
I've always loved Noah's bagels and was juiced to come across one on my route to the office. I'm an early bird so I'm in the city by 630am and the streets are not yet crowded. This place is open really early which is convenient. 

The morning I came, I was lucky it wasn't busy. Three staff members were on deck, one finishing several catering orders, the other handling register, and the third making the orders. I ordered the lox bagel sandwich. They were very generous with the cream cheese and capers. The lox itself was not spread all the way even, but I still got some with every bite I took. It was warm and toasted, I mean how could one mess up toasting a bagel?!

I didn't find anything wrong with this place and would gladly pick Noah's over the mediocre baked goods at Specialty's across the street.
author: Jenna T.

description:
This Noah's sucks.
The service here is slow and unattentive even if there's only one customer in the store. But whatever, cause I stay away from carbs during the work week anyway.

However, I did order catering for the office because it's one of the easier catering options. But they forgot the cream cheese of all things. How do you not have cream cheese with bagels? Pointless.

We had to call the general help line, who then connected us to the store and we pretty much had to argue for our cream cheese.. like. Why would we lie about not having it in the first place? The same person who delivered it in the first place ended up bringing us the cream cheese that THEY forgot thirty minutes after everything, super unapologetic, when 80% of the bagels were already eaten.

No thanks. No more business from anyone in our office.
author: Emily C.

description:
Solid 3.5.

Service is prompt. 
Prices are fair.
Bagels and food are good.

You are sure to get a NYC vibe. It's very crowded, even at 5:30am but my breakfast is always made promptly and the bagels are always very tasty. 

I get where this place doesn't have five stars. It's not a five-star kind of place but it is good and predictable and fast. I will be back.
author: Justin S.

description:
For the convenience of location this bagel spot is ok and will do for a breakfast crunch time.
But don't be fooled by the name Noah's New York bagels - this doesn't come close to a nyc/jersey bagel - so if you're expecting such, you will be disappointed.

The bagels are decent - comparable to supermarket store bought bagels. They carry a good variety - plain, sesame, everything, poppy, even egg. 
The smear is lackluster - limited options on reduce/low fat flavors. The onion and chive smear lacked flavor and freshness. I don't know about you but shouldn't there be some vibrant green specks in chive/ scallion cream cheese? I saw some specks but they were more like burnt green/brown ....bleh not very appetizing

During the breakfast rush - service is super slow.
Not sure how fresh it is but they carry beef flavored doggie bagels in the jar by the cash register.
author: Brenda L.

description:
What happened to this Noah's?    A few years ago when my office was located right across the street I was a daily customer here.  Service was great, bagels were fresh, selection of bagels was great.  Then my office moved and there was another Noah's closer so I started going there.
Now I'm with a different firm and this location is closer again so I started going back but boy was it disappointing.

It must have changed hands because none of the management team I remember is still there.  There is rarely a full selection of bagels and the sandwiches are thrown together without much care.  I used to get a turkey sausage egg mitt with Swiss cheese and green onion on it.  First of all I was informed that they don't have green onion anymore.  They changed the way they cook the eggs.  Instead of a light fluffy egg it's a smooshed puck of egg.  I took one bite and threw it away.  

I ordered a turkey deli sandwich with Swiss and mayo.  A few years ago when I ordered this, I got the sandwich, all the veggies on it, pickle on the side and chips.  Today I was informed that the veggies cost extra, no one offered pickle and no one asked if I wanted chips.  The review just prior to mine from Jessica S, shows that her turkey sandwich had loads of turkey on it.  Looking at the picture she posted mine barely had a quarter of what her sandwich had. 

The woman who seems to be running the show on weekday mornings doesn't seem very friendly or interested in being there.  People at this location used to be happy, smiling and friendly.  I knew them all by first name.  This used to be a GREAT Noah's.  Now it's horrible.  The two other Financial District Noah's have closed so I guess Noah's is off my daily list.
author: Bob S.

description:
First time eating breakfast here and it was truly great! I got the farmhouse bagel sandwich and the jalepeno spread.  It was served in quick fashion and with a friendly smile.  Not much more needed from this guy.  The interior of this location is nothing special but spacious and laid out well enough not to impeded flow during rush hours.

The only drawback and something I'd probably request upfront next visit would be to go light on the schmear.  It was a little too much product for my tastes but it certainly didn't stop me from eating the entire sandwich!
author: Travis W.

description:
I usually get bagels and cream cheese for me and my coworkers on Saturday and faithfully spend $30.00,will this past weekend on the day of 
September 23,2017 I arrived at my normal time at 7:30 am but was told to return at 8:00 am due to a large order that they were preparing for someone, well I returned at 8:15 am and opened the door and the girl yelled at me "were still closed " and then told me to leave. Very unprofessional???? I will never buy bagels there again.
author: Rick D.

description:
This Noah's Bagel is super busy in the morning. There is usually a line; sometimes out the door. 

The service is great. The workers are working fast to get the orders out. And the cashiers work fast to get the line down. 

This is the only Noah's Bagel in the financial district. They closed the big one down by the Hyatt Hotel in the Embarcadero Center. 
That one didn't seem so crazy busy. 

I like this location. It's located in a very nice building. Very old S.F. I hope they never close this Noah's down. 

I come here a lot. I was sooo excited when I saw they had a French Toast bagel! 
But they don't have it every day. My second favorite is the Gourmet Spinach bagel.
author: Edie G.

description: Noah's Bagels are delicious so this isn't a review of the store chain and their bagels in general. However, this particular location is consistently sloooooow in service. I've tried to figure out if it's understaffed...mismanaged...or whatever might be the cause. Noah's, if you're reading this...send in a regional manager to fix this!
author: Geoff M.

description:
This is by far the worse Noah's Bagels I've been to. 

Every time I come here, they get my order wrong. Most recently, I ordered a bagel sandwich which normally comes on a specific specialty bagel. They only had one left in the display. Then someone came along AFTER I had ordered, and ordered just a toasted bagel that happened to be the one that my sandwich was supposed to come on. Then after paying for the sandwich and waiting for my order, they later tell me  "oh we're now sold out of that bagel". If they had taken the bagel out when I originally ordered, that would have never happened to begin with. Then there's been several other instances where my order was just flat out wrong. 

Additionally, they're supposed to close at 5:30pm (according to the hours posted here on Yelp) and every time I've gone in around 4:30 - 4:45, they're reluctant to help me OR I've been turned away as they've told me that they're "already closed". If you're going to close 45 minutes - 1 hour early, then you should just change your hours...
author: Alan H.

description: This place is a mess and always seems on the verge of chaos.  Biggest gripe is their awful weak coffee.  Add the tiniest bit of milk to their "dark roast" and the coffee looses all its color and flavor.  I'd come by for the occasional bagel or muffin in the morning, but pass it by now as I can't stand their watered down coffee.
author: Sean M.

description:
My girlfriend wanted a cinnamon raisin bagel, so I stopped here to get her that plus myself a turkey bacon bagel. 

I noticed they were busy so I though "okay, 15 or so minutes should be about right." 15 minutes went by and I was starting to get concerned. I used to work in a restaurant so I know how it can be, so I waited another 20 before asking. 

I asked the cashier what was going on and gave her my receipt, then she went to the kitchen and found the cinnamon raisin bagel sitting there. She ask the crew "hey, where is the sandwich" and ALL 4 members just looked at each other, then the order screen, and one said "we don't see the order." Odd, since they had the bagel ready. Then another said, "did he pay yet?" The cashier is literally showing you my receipt, YES, I paid. 

Another 10 minutes go by until my order is ready. I get handed a bag and a "sorry about that." No you are not; you don't care. How do I know? Like I said, I worked in a restaurant before. For a 30 minute wait, you can have the manager apologize, throw a free plain bagel, throw an orange juice, comp the meal, offer something next time. Any of those would have turn the day around by making it right. 

Instead I am pissed for wasting time (good thing I am usually 40 minutes early to work) and feel the whole place didn't care.  here is the kicker, the turkey bacon is cold and hard. Great! And the bonus, after I talked to the cashier, several other people were behind me asking for their food. So I wasn't the only one left to dry. 

To the cashier - I know is not an easy job, so the review doesn't go to her. She actually got control of the situation and was helpful. The rest of the experience was a disaster.
author: Javier H.

description:
Today is my first visit to Noah bagels which is famous in sfo. I can it's a world of bagels with different flavours of shimmers and good variety of beverages as well. This store is quite looking like a 1900 classic store with all classic interior designed. Finally I had nutty banana bagel and hot cocoa which is my fav. I felt prices of beverages are low and bagel prices are bit pricy and good in taste but frankly speaking I didn't like bagel concept, I will vote for the doubts instead of bagels.

Worth a visit for beverages
author: Sandeep R.

description: This must be the most poorly managed place I have ever seen. Line out the door, twenty minutes to get a mediocre bagel, employees seemingly uninterested in trying to provide better service. Today they had only seven pumpernickel bagels (zero other bagels) available at morning rush. At a bagel shop. Maybe the poor health rating will finally shut this place down so we can get a better replacement concept in this location.
author: Kelli S.

description: If you're ordering catering, go somewhere else. I order catering biweekly for my office and had a big meeting coming up. I placed an online order days in advance of the catering order, only to be notified ONE HOUR before the meeting that my order was cancelled. Ridiculous. Corner Bakery & Specialty's have much better customer service than this place.
author: Gael M.

description: Understaffed and inefficient.  You could wait 30 minutes for a bagel that's just ok.  Good luck making that meeting
author: Bill B.

description: This location is terrible. I ordered 2 bagels toasted, 1 with plain shmear and 1 with jalapeno salsa shmear. Neither bagel was toasted and both had plain shmear. How much more wrong can you be, stop rushing at get your orders right.
author: Ross D.

description: I loved that Noah's was right around the corner from my old office. This is where I went almost every morning for my cup of coffee. Why would I go to a bagel shop for my coffee when I'm surrounded by coffee shops and cafes? Because not only can I get a yummy bagel if I chose, but I can actually get a decent cup of coffee for under $2, and I love their Chelsea Blend (Vanilla Hazelnut flavored).  I have also bought the 'backers dozen' before, and it's great how convenient they make it for you. All 13 are already packed and ready to go...you just have to chose the smear.
author: Rachel E.

description:
Passing along the same rating for all other Noah's Bagels locations.  This is now the closest location to my work since they shut down the Howard and 1st Street location.  This place does get really busy in the mornings and I usually see plenty of customers waiting in line as well as delivery people taking carts out to deliver orders.  

I'm so glad that I have mostly a gluten free diet as I do sometimes miss having an occasional asiago cheese bagel with plain cream cheese.
author: Ben H L.

description: Great bagels. Shocked to have a pop up on food safety after I ate there.  Very courteous staff. I hope they have corrected the issues. Would love to revisit this place on my next trip.
author: Paula H.

description:
Over 25 people waiting for bagels. 2 people making them slooooooowly.

They need MUCH better management.  It shouldn't take 15 minutes for a bagel.

You can see them making their catering boxes as the crowd builds in the store.  Maybe try making the bagels people are ordering.
author: Lauren C.

description: Bagel itself was actually great but they didn't put cream cheese on about a third of the bagel and didn't have any orange juice left at 7:30 am!  Didn't seem to care either.
author: Kelly G.

description:
This place is teeny tiny.

You can almost overlook this place because of where it is located. It is on the corner and and across the street from Peet's Coffee & Tea. There are a couple of seats inside around the windows to sit. The bagels are decent. I usually get the Asiago bagel with some cream cheese and keep it moving when I come here. 

The best place to sit would have to be near the window. This area tends to get pretty busy so expect heavy foot traffic, especially around lunchtime. 

The MUNI Train and BART both drop you off a block from this location. 

It's Just NOAH'S....
author: Robert F.

description: Really bad customer service. No matter what u tell them they will make it the way they want to
author: George S.

description: Bagels are nothing but average price is fair at $1.35 for a classic bagel and $2 for gourmet. Service was quick and the establishment was clean and not very crowded.
author: Caleb J.

description:
We have been here a few times when visiting San Francisco, and it's a wonderful place for breakfast.  Today, we both had the swiss and spinach bagel, toasted and filled with cream cheese. The bread was just chewy enough, with melted swiss cheese and fresh spinach in the center.  The cream cheese filling took it to another level. Noah's features self serve coffee, with my husband enjoying full octane and me drinking decaf.  But hey, my decaf was just fine.  
Typically, we go upstairs and eat.  But it was closed off today.  We managed to find a table downstairs.  The area was filled with boxes and bags of bagels to go.  This company must do a bang up catering business.  
I truly enjoy this San Francisco breakfast tradition.
author: Robin C.

description:
Get fountain drinks!  And don't tell me you don't have room. I see a cash register sitting on a counter that isn't being used. Put it there.

Oh, and while your at it, trying spreading the cream cheese on the bagel, instead of lumping it on one spot.
author: J M.

description: I needed a quick bagel to go with my egg nog latte this Black Friday. Noah's was open  but this chain seems like a shell of it's former self. It did not look too clean or inviting to stay and eat as it once did.
author: Infodiva B.

description:
You can simply get a variety of bagels with cream cheese and other fillings at this bagel chain in the FiDi area!

Service is slow.  I waited quite a while for one bagel to be toasted and to spread the cream cheese!

A decent and good spot for a bite on breakfast or lunch!
author: Tiffany D.

description: Lots of variety for bagels and coffee - this place is mostly popular for large orders esp their bakers dozen - an assortment of 13 bagels that you can pick yourself. They have a lot of good options for cream cheeses as well. Usually there is a big line so you end up waiting for 15 minutes at a minimum. However, since it is smack in the middle of FiDi, ideal to grab a quick breakfast by yourself, with your team from work as also to cater breakfast at work.
author: Reema B.

description:
I've been going to Noah's for 20+ years, but never again. I ordered the trout sandwich on sourdough. A girl from the back rudely yelled that they didn't have any trout. Fine. I ordered the lox, without capers, on sourdough, with potato salad. I wait 10 minutes to pay because, although they had 5 people standing around the back, they had one person who didn't know how to work the cash register on register duty, leading to a crowd of people standing around with their food waiting to pay. While I'm waiting a girl yells back at a coworker to grab a potato salad. The other coworker yells back that she doesn't want to make up any containers of potato salad because she's doing something else, so the first girl yells at me to say "we don't have any potato salad." Well, of course you do. I just heard that you have potato salad. You're choosing not to give me any. 
I get back to my desk to find a lox sandwich on a plain bagel covered in capers.
author: J. W.

description: There is a decent selection of bagels and good selection of cream cheeses. I went in the morning and although there wasn't a whole lot of people, it was a bit longer than I expected. Also, I got my bagel toasted but it certainly isn't warm. Tasty bagel otherwise- I got the spinach cheese bagel with veggie cream cheese.
author: Sheereen S.

description: Bagels are always yummy here.  Have it toasted with cream cheese and it's satisfying. The cashier was not smiling at all...sigh.  Good thing the bagels are good!
author: Coco C.

description: I ordered my food, and watched people that came in and ordered after me receive their food first. Soon my order was ready and I left to eat outside. When I finally sat down to eat my food it was the wrong order, so I had to walk back down the street to get it corrected. When you're on lunch break that's the last thing you want to do. Never again, I'll find somewhere else to go.
author: Marche B.

description: So another awful bagel experience...I order my asiago bagel and there are plenty of them left, but after they ring me up and a few customers later they decide to let 2 people purchasing multiple bagels buy all of them. Instead of pulling my bagel out when I ordered and paid for it or checking to make sure that the orders before these people are taking care of it, they decide to pull all the asiago bagels. I stand there for another 10 minutes waiting for my bagel when finally someone calls my name to ask me what bagel i want instead since they sold all the asiago bagels... This has happened a few times now...thank god there are a lot of options in downton SF, as this place has lost my business forever as far as i am concerned and would highly recommend others find a better place to go to!!!
author: Jason W.

description:
This place sucks. They are always out of my first and second choices when I go. This last and final time i came in and of course had to settle for my second choice. I ordered my bagel and paid for it and waited about five minutes when my name was called. I thought that my bagel was ready but what in fact happened they had sold my order to a larger order from a business. They clearly had an entire row of bagels when i ordered AND PAID for it, but they re-sold it. The excuse was that there was an order before mine...REALLY! 
Bastards had only plain and bagels that I don't eat left. wasted my time and was even not offered a comp.
author: Fabian S.

description: Ordered Blueberry and got cinnamon raisin. Very stingy on schmear. To top it all off, parts of the bagel tasted like onion. Unattentive service. I'll be going elsewhere for my morning bagel from now on.
author: Yige Z.

description: Was wandering around San Francisco early on a Saturday morning and stumbled upon this place. I ordered a chai tea latte and a toasted everything bagel with cream cheese. It cost $6, so I guess it's a moderate pricing? As far as bagels go, it tasted decent, the chai tea latte was amazing though.
author: Rachael J.

description: They never make enough bagels to accommodate walk in orders and only fill delivery orders. Service could better too.
author: Al G.

description:
The Food is good, but you literally have to scream out your order to them since the music & machinery is LOUD!  The cashier, MONIQUE, has a very bad attitude!  Not going to come here ever again!
We had ordered two sandwiches and a salad.  We got the salad 17 minutes later and it was not made the way it was ordered, we asked for onions, cucumber and asparagus on the salad, which we never got.  We were charged $1.50 for these three items and the lady, maybe owner, refused that refund of $1.50.  Poor service all around, nobody even asked what they can help us with while waiting on the salad. The worst service ever!!
author: C.K U.

description: I keep going back hoping it will live up to my expectations of Noah's Bagels, but, alas, it never does. Looks like they just smash the bagel together with the cream cheese in the middle rather than spread it and they usually have the bagel slightly burnt. The very LAST feeling I have here is that I'm valued as a customer. It's like they just want to throw you some food and get out the way. Yet, I continue to go there on occasion just because it's near my job.
author: Alana P.

description:
Thought I already wrote a review for how little I like Noah's but I guess I'm a glutton for punishment because knowing how bad it was I obviously went back for more. Reason being, I found a coupon page near my compost can and couldn't BELIEVE my roommates would toss such a treasure. 

Went in the first time with a coupon for buy one get one free lunch sandwiches with a friend, I got a rueben and he got a lox bagel I think. The bread my sandwich was served on actually tasted like and had the same consistency as brown paper napkins, but I assure you it was in fact bread. Um, I thought it would be served on a bagel, this is a bagel place, no? The meat was good and the meal came with chips, so I guess lose, win.

I went back this morning with a 20% off coupon and got a sesame bagel with egg, bacon, and cheddar. The bagel was rubbery and the egg and bacon had no flavor. I brought it back to my office and tried to toast the bagel more to make it crispy without success. Are these things just old as dirt or microwaved? I don't get it. Anyway, it was $4.30 with 20% but honestly they should have paid me to eat it because I was basically taking out the trash. 

To sum it up, booooo, I will not be back anytime soon.
author: Crystal C.

description:
I SHOULD BE KNOWN AS "OH ITS THAT GIRL WITH THE WEIRD ORDER"
(3 stars)

... but instead I am known as "Next customer, how can I help you?" (same person taking my order nearly every morning). 

I literally come here every morning and order the same thing "Blueberry bagel, no creamcheese, no nothing, no toasted... just slice in half and cut into smaller pieces". Only for him to ask "so you don't want it toasted? do you want it sliced and cut?" Didn't I say that today, yesterday, the day before yesterday and the days/weeks after that. 

Might I add, their blueberry bagel is divine. It's so soft and the blueberry gives it that light sweetness you really do not need to put anything on it. 

Will I be back? I'm addicted to that bagel.

Until the next review....
author: Jane A.

description:
Really not bad for a bagel chain. The ordering system, albeit frightening and seemingly hectic at first, is really quite efficient and friendly. Typical of me, I panicked upon ordered and went straight for what I usually go for when it comes to bagel-type-of-mornings: lox and bagels.

The thin variation of their everything bagel is everything you want in a bagel. It's tasty with all the right seasonings, but not too bready like regular bagels. The salmon was fresh and all the ingredients were in equal proportion. It might just be my lack of talent with money and numbers, but the prices did seem a little steep for a bagel joint, but then again that could just be San Francisco. Oye Vay - I still like my bagels by the bay!
author: Frances H.

description: Not entirely bad like a lot of these reviews are saying, but this spot isn't anything extraordinary. Came here today on break and ordered the South West Turkey breakfast sandwich on a thing bagel. The guy who ordered my food was nice enough, but the young man that took my order didn't even look at me once and was just trying to shuffle me out. Never even asked me if I wanted a receipt..quite rude. I waited about 6 minutes for my food (this wasn't a particularly busy time around 11am). The sandwich was great! I use to grab a bite at the Noah's in Berkeley and this reminded me of how good it could be. The spot itself is alright with a lot of selection, but it definitely could benefit from a sweep from the look of the crumbs on the ground. Also, not sure if they're in the middle of doing some moving, but half of the second floor can't even be used because they have boxes stacked up on half the tables and chairs up there. I would probably come back if I'm craving this particular sandwich again, but I will definitely be looking for some friendly local spots to try out first!
author: James R.

description: 5 stars easily. Had the turkey sausage and egg on a thin bagel but upgraded to jalapeño and cheese bagel. Comes with a cream cheese as well. Quick service I didn't find it loud of loud machinery like another comment below and I was there on a Saturday morning. I would like to go back again tomorrow while in town. Stumbled upon it while walking and very glad I came in!! Lots of bagels and cream cheeses for sale. Thank you for a delicious breakfast!!
author: Shannon L.

description: We stopped in for breakfast, the coffee was taking a min to make so they gave us free cookies!! We thought it was so sweet. The food was great, the coffee was better but the employees were the best!!
author: Stacey C.

description:
Only went three times here. First, last and only time.

I ordered my bagel. A minute later I heard a server screaming into the room "NO POPPY!" 

Since I had ordered poppy seeds, I was thinking they might want me to change my order... So I just went with plain. 

Then I waited and waited and every new costumer got his/her bagel but not me. No one was wondering why I am still there empty handed. So I asked and got this response: "I put it on the table there." And then something like "pran with sirmoin right?!" which was probably supposed to mean "plain with salmon." 

Needless to say the bagel was gross.
author: René X.

description:
Got the jalepeno and cheese bagel with cream cheese - toasted.  Was delicious.    Was out for a big night of drinking and shuffleboard the night before so had to grab something to soak up the juices.  Just what the doctor ordered, so
Five Stars!!
author: George P.

description:
Most days good service but two screw-ups of my orders in the last five days. The first screw-up resulted in NO APOLOGY from any of the staff. 

The second screw-up? A toasted plain bagel with salmon and nothing else on it. A good bagel sandwich...until the last part of the bagel, which was wet inside and tasted as if someone spat in it. I felt sick afterwards. No reason to make any of that up.

Spoke to manager who was receptive but mildly so. I had to ask for my money back. Manager never initiated such an offer. Said he'd speak to the person who made the bagel. But it's too late: I won't be patronizing this or any other Noah's Bagels again. I'm not going to wait for something else unholy to show up in a bagel. 

Note: Customer service in general in the United States has taken a nosedive over the last few years. The mantra: Profits over quality and service. Customers suffer in the process - as does the product itself.
author: Omar M.

description:
You walk in...

1 cinnamon raisin, toasted, plain smear.

You pay.

You wait approximately 2 minutes.

You pickup your toasted bagel.

It's hot and fresh and waiting for you to bite into it.

You run back to the office to preserve it's hotness.

You open the bag up and take a big bite.

Crunch...plain smear oozes out slightly. 

You lick around the rim of the bagel to clean it up.

Crunch munch smunch.

You wipe away the crumbs on your shirt.

Satisfaction.
author: Jenny T.

description:
I love Noah's bagels in general but for some reason what we have at this location doesn't seem to be the best/fresh. 

And please put some pesto in your "pesto" gourmet. :)
author: Jazzy H.

description:
5/5 for service. Staff is super nice and occasionally gives me free coffee. Nice cozy secret seating upstairs. If I were ever to play hooky from work, I would hide here and take a nap.

Toasted bagel sandwiches are okay, but great price and taste fresh. Fan inside is really loud... bring some headphones.
author: Kyle L.

description:
Ew! Ew! I was just checking in on Yelp 10 minutes ago waiting in line at lunch. Press check in here. You are now checked into Noah's Bagels. I was eyeing a chicken salad sandwich on an egg bagel. The line was moving but I was 3rd in line. 
Suddenly a scream behind me! What? Crazy lady behind me. We all looked at her. "There is a Cockroach right there!!" As she pointed to this HUGE cockroach crouched on the side of the wall to our right. 
Uhhh I was next in line by then. We all told the cashier there is a huge cockroach - right there and pointed to it. 
He said oh. Smiled. Said he'll be right with us and still decided to help the guy in line. Ugh. We all left. 
I'm never coming here again and I'm telling my whole floor and building there was a cockroach in Noah's Bagels on Bush and the cashier brushed us off!!! 
Needless to say I was first in line by then and left.
author: Jacqueline L.

description: What's better than a case of fresh bagels and treats available to you while on your way to work?? My response: not much!! This location has a huge selection of bagels and pastry treats ready at 6:45am every day when my bus drops me off right out front. The staff seems to know you're in a hurry and helps you get your bagel or treat fast and you're out the door!  Bravo!!
author: Sandra P.

description:
I'm going to echo what many other Yelpers have already said about this location.  

It's is way too busy & it takes too long to get even a simple toasted bagel + shmear.  

The setup is weird & confusing.  You order from one register & pay at another at the other end of the counter.  Why?  It just slows down the whole process. 

The bagels are just OK.  I thought I used to like Noah's but my blueberry bagel + butter lacked flavor.

On the plus side, I'm pretty sure I got a few bagels for free cuz I only paid $3 for 3 bagels & coffee.  The holiday blend coffee was good.  They also give you a coupon for $2 off any lunch sandwich and since I'm a sucker for a good deal, I will probably be back for lunch.  I'm hoping it's not as crazy busy during the lunch hour.
author: Erin S.

description:
My office is moving in a couple weeks, and as much as I'll miss a lot about my little corner of the financial district, I am SO EXCITED to no longer go to this Noah's. 

The two stars are because yes, you do get a bagel, and yes, it does taste exactly how a Noah's bagel everywhere else tastes. So props for that.

On the flip side, this Noah's is located in an extremely busy area and is utterly incapable of handling the volume. I've taken to buying a tub of cream cheese every couple of weeks, so that when I go to Noah's I only need to wait in line to order, and then wait in line to pay (cutting out the wait for my bagel to be made, which I will touch on next). At a busy time, it can still take 10+ minutes for me to literally get a plain untoasted bagel and pay $1 for it. 

Back in the old days, before I came up with my cream-cheese-in-bulk strategy, I'd wait up for 20 minutes for a bagel with cream cheese. I'm pretty sure the two women they have actually making bagels (out of the 8 or 9 people behind the counter) literally do one bagel at a time. They grab it, toast it, cream cheese it, hand it off, and then begin the next order. Every time I'd watch, my analytic efficient part of my brain would go crazy. 

We all go to these Noah's because the bagel is predictable and the prices are good, but for such a high volume location they should really consider something like new management and an additional bagel toaster.
author: Eve D.

description: Service is consistently bad. They appear to not want to wait on their customers.
author: Gene R.

description: First off ill say that im born and raised in NY and have quite a high standard for my bagels eating them just about my whole life. The everything bagel was not a normal bagel. I don't think it was boiled and then baked. It was like a soft and semi dense bread close to bagel consistency but not quite. Some of the other bagels looked very much like a normal bagel but I would need to try more to opine. Second the lox spread or lox cream cheese was terrible. Nothing like the thick cream cheese with chunks of fresh lox I am used to. It tasted very light, whipped with air and the salmon was small and didn't seem fresh. The smear as they refer to it was very processed.
author: Matthew L.

description:
Most expensive and slowest Noah's I've been to. Why do they have so many people waiting to get their simple toasted bagel?!

As an IT guy I see their equipment and process needs to be changed. You have people standing around doing nothing. Your toasters are from 1886, the same year as the NYC reprints on the wall.
author: Silicon W.

description:
This review is for Noah's Delivery Service, my semi-weekly orders for my office are always filled from this location. 

I am continually disappointed that this Noah's location cannot get their act together and deliver my order at the time I specify. Their website has you choose a 15 minute delivery window, yet week after week after week my orders that are filled at this store are delivered MORE THAN AN HOUR BEFORE my scheduled delivery time.

 I have talked to their catering manager multiple times. They have put multiple notes on my account stating that my orders must be delivered when I've actually requested them, and that I am the only person who can sign for them. Does Not Matter. I show up at work to find that the bagels were dropped off and have been sitting out for god knows how long; and that substitutions were made without my permission, or items have been forgotten. 

This is completely unacceptable and I am this close to finding a new supplier. My office has been a loyal Noah's customer for years and have spent thousands of dollars on bagels in that time, but I cannot put up with this amateur level of service any longer. Why offer a delivery window if they're just going to drop off the order whenever they feel like it? Extremely unprofessional.
author: Kelly C.

description:
Ripped Off and Incompetent 

Was hungry trying to wake up and decided I could use a simple bagel. Ordered a garlic with cream-cheese and butter. 

I went to pay and and it was over $5. More than $5 for a basic bagel with cream cheese??? I tried to figure out why it was so expensive. The bagel itself was $1.50 or so. So obviously that means a smear cream-cheese is $3.00-$3.50?? I wanted to verify but couldn't find any prices on the menu and didn't get a receipt. 

I shruged off the gourmet price for the bagel and waited. Finally it comes..........They got the garlic right. They did put butter on it. But my overly expensive cream cheese was no where to be found. 

I can excuse one or two  faults but the lack of transparency, the high price and incomplete order leaves this place begging to be shutdown or replaced with new management. 

Go to Katz or Posh bagel instead. Noah's bagels are mediocre at best.
author: Josh L.

description:
....Eh.

Note that I did not have a bagel, but I did buy the pretzel bagel bites dipped in chocolate. Talk about a salt OVERLOAD. For someone who's never been there, they weren't very helpful.
author: Monica M.

description: Noah's gets a 4th star for the turkey sausage. Way to look out for us non pork eaters. The food was worth every penny. You get what you pay for and the price is reasonable. Enjoyed the turkey sausage and egg sandwich on a cinnamon raisin bagel. You have me as a customer as long as you keep with the turkey sausage.
author: Victor B.

description: My bae and I were trying to find a nice little breakfast spot before we started our day... I love bagels. Bagels are my jam. And my bae loved the spinach bagel with salmon cream cheese. The staff is so nice. And everything was made swiftly and with care. I am starting my day off right because of the folks working here. Thank you so much!
author: Jaclynn F.

description: The service was slow and the breakfast sandwich was mediocre. The cashier had her phone sticking out of her pocket, and then started playing music on it soon after we walked upstairs to eat. The music was horribly loud and obnoxious.
author: Annalisa L.

description:
Coming to work on the weekend following a long work week sucks. Having a warm Santa Fe turkey sausage egg wrap plus hot coffee waiting for me when I get to the office, not so sucky.

There's really nothing fancy about Noah's Bagels but it's a reliable breakfast grab-and-go place. They are our provider for bagel Mondays and they've always delivered on time. I appreciate the lower fat shmears. Less a fan of the strawberry one. Huge fan of the smoked salmon one although we don't get that one as much I guess because it's more expensive? 

Breakfast around the Fidi on the weekend can be slim pickings on the weekend and Noah's is one of few options. I appreciated my breakfast wrap today. Nothing extraordinary but satisfying fuel to begin an extra workday on the weekend.
author: Jon L.

description: I've been here a couple times since this location is on my walk to work, but I give up. They have never gotten my order right once. This morning, I repeated twice "no salsa", and after I make my way to my office and sit down, I unwrap my bagel to find it drenched in salsa, basically too soggy to eat (not to mention the fact that it was supposed to be a bagelthin and very much wasn't...) You've also got to ask to have everything double-toasted since their version of toasted is vaguely warm. The wait for mediocre bagels is far too long here for them to be serving up the wrong food.
author: Lara K.

description:
(See pics) Review #1114. Noah Noah is where the rescue is when you need carby bagels and very hot coffee! Sign up for the e-club to also get a free bagel with spread when you get a drink.

This Noah's is similar to the one on Mission and is at a corner. Excellent to be seen as you walk by but always seem to be a bit awkward interior wise. It might very well be because it tries to showcase a full case of bagels.

I love the peppercorn potato with the different kinds of cheese and an egg. Plus they always ask if you want it with salt, pepper and chives. I always want to pound everything in. If you are loading all that food up to indulge for the day, might as well not skimp on anything.

Kinda wish they had seating at this store, like the one on Mission Street.

Love the bite size bagel popper and the cute Valentine's Day heart shaped ones. Totally capitalizing it the day. If shops are doing it, they should do it like everyday is Valentine's Day, like how you can send everyday cards just to tell someone you care. Because it's the unexpected that's the sweetest and spontaneous. And it really shows you truly care, and not just a festive reminder.

Okay, maybe not the carbs to that special someone though.
author: T L.

description:
I came in for the first time this morning and as you'd expect at 9:00am on a Monday, it was packed.  No big deal though, the process of ordering and paying was pretty good.  I order a wheat bagel with cream cheese, toasted.  Prettsy simple right?  Well, I get to work and find my bagel wasn't toasted it at all.  It wasn't even warm, and certainly not fresh out of the oven like some people have mentioned.  Needless to say, the bagel wasn't all that good without it being toasted.  And it was a little soggy, probably from being taken out of the oven prematurely.  

Maybe this is a one time things and I should give Noah's another try, but I'm hesitant.  If I do, I'll make sure I check my order before I leave to make sure they got it right.
author: Stephanie W.

description:
I've been getting coupons in the mail for Buy One Get One Free Sandwiches. I get the lox bagel which comes with a side of potato salad, fruit salad or chips. Total comes down to $7.99 - for TWO sandwiches and TWO sides. Amazing deal! Just keep your eyes out for the weekly flier.

The staff has always been very friendly and accommodating. For the Yelpers who don't think you got enough cream cheese you could ask for more - I'm sure they'll gladly do it.
author: Lancelot W.

description:
Was downtown for a business meeting and hungry so I figured that I would stop by for a quick snack. I love all sorts of bagels so believe me when I say my expectations weren't that high.

Ordered the onion bagel + toasted with cream cheese. It didn't take that long but the place WAS empty so I can imagine on a busy morning you'd have to wait awhile.

2 stars because there was not much cream cheese on my bagel AND home boy at the register gave me a disapproving look when I used my credit card to buy my bagel. Pay day is on Friday so get off my case, brah
author: Jennifer H.

description:
Pumped.

Must have been a bad day in August 2008. Reading my old yelp wanted to go back and see if things really were that bad. They aren't.

Americano was ready in less than 5 minutes. Had to add water myself. Guy behind the counter didn't charge for a pump of sugar free vanilla syrup. Only $2.

Second time was much better than the first.
author: Jason B.

description: Slow bagels is more like it. Blame it on the breakfast rush but I got my bagel after the person behind me got his. Hmmm...
author: Pam C.

description:
I love this place. There's an ease in ordering and quick pay. I love the staff here and they always have great smiles and pleasant attitudes. 

I don't get reviews of people saying that the sandwiches, bagels and smears etc being too expensive. How is there a sticker shock when you see what the prices are up on the board that you are ordering from? Perhaps the only thing that Noah's can do is put a calculator next to their register for the people that can't add can see what they're going to pay before the cashier rings them up. If you want something that is cheap go to Safeway, buy some cream cheese and bagels and have it at home.

Back to the review. The smears are always great, fresh produce, good quality meats. If you want something more upscale go to whole foods.

Love this place, will always go back!
author: ryan n.

description: First time at Noah's, hoping to get a delicious bagel sandwich to start off my day. I order the southwestern turkey bagel and answer 'yes' if I would like it toasted. Not only did the bagel taste bad, it wasn't toasted, felt extremely soggy honestly, and there was a long black hair in my food. First and last time here
author: Jason D.

description:
Good service. I've had egg whites on a bagel. I've had lox on bagel lunch sandwich, wish that it were available not as a lunch combo.
Good place to grab a quick box of bagels to bring into the office. (Contrast that with The Boudin Bakery on Market Street which took forever to box up a dozen bagels, and cost $10 more.)
author: Mike C.

description:
Ugh.

Maybe it's my own fault for coming here at 7:55 on a Tuesday and being surprised that I am treated like part of a herd of cattle ...

Either way, I'm not sure if it's this particular location or Noah's as a whole that I'm disliking. I echo some of the other reviews on here. The garlic and herb cream cheese is to die for, but the soggy, undercooked bagel makes it almost inedible.

I think my 10 year love affair with Noah's is coming to an end... let me know if you have recommendations for other bagel places in this area.
author: Erica W.

description: Unreliable catering services. They delivered 40 minutes late - customer service was poorly trained and rude.
author: Sonya C.

description:
SO disappointing, I remember way back when when Noah's was good. The $4 everything bagel was completely smushed, and soggy after a 2 block walk from bush to Montgomery. 

The top was extremely salty. 

The schmear was good, but it's pretty hard to make a bad cream cheese. 

I added avo and tomato, the avo was practically a quarter of an avo on bread, one big lump right in the middle.

I won't be going back. Sorry Noah's.
author: Kortni S.

description: 15 Minutes For A Bagel And A Shmear. By The Time It's My Turn . They Don't Have My Bagel Type. Paid For Asiago . Received A Plain .... Will Not Be Returning Or Suggesting This Particular Location To Anyone
author: Gregory P.

description:
A douchey cashier, $1.50 to put a smear of cream cheese on a sandwich (they're already $5-$6, will a free smear kill ya?), un-toasted bagels when toasted is requested, and no cups for coffee: four strikes in one visit.  

I sampled the Sante Fe sandwich (cheddar, sausage, and salsa) and the Bacon and Cheddar.  Both were unremarkable but not bad (the Sante Fe was the winner), but the poor customer experience leading up to finally eating them certainly didn't help psychologically.  I had a "buy one, get one free coupon" for a sandwich, which was the reason I came here to begin with.  At 600 calories a pop, the last two halves from both sandwiches have to wait for lunch.  I doubt they'll hold out, even refrigerated; see what a shitty first impression does?  I have no proof it won't hold out, but I already want to dismiss this joint.

With so many other options out there vying for my breakfast dollar, why give this a second chance?
author: Shawn C.

description: Isn't it the law to provide a restroom to customers when you sell food and beverages? Where do I wash my hands to eat? I will never come here again!!!!
author: Nancy H.

description: This location is crazy. Long long long lines. Slow service. I literally spied 2 grown adult men stealing bagels right off their cars. Employees did nothing. Wrong.
author: Katie Anne N.

description: Asked me if I wanted my bagel toasted. I said yes. It is not toasted. I could go back, but... Ain't nobody got time for that!
author: Andy P.

description: Just an all around huge fan of Noah's. It's a pretty convenient location in the city, and pretty quick too. There are three doors; two to enter and one to exit. The place itself is designed nicely for flow of service to order, pay and receive. I'm all about that Strawberry Shmear!
author: Taryn C.

description: Let me start off by saying that i always get a simple bagel nothing too crazy and an orange juice. The house made orange juice isn't too good but they have a bottled one that is very good. I don't really care if my orange juice is fresh squeezed or not. The staff here is really nice and remembers my order. I will be coming back here for all of my bagel needs.
author: Jasmin P.

description:
This is a review of the bagel, lox & cream cheese product and of its pricing.

Hadn't been here in years and decided to pop in to get a bagel w lox & cream cheese. I know salmon prices have gone through the roof, so I wanted to be sure the price was reasonable. When I scanned the menu I saw "bagel schmear with lox" priced at $3.69. I placed the order but the price came out to $7.75...because I wanted a bagel with "real" fish (not bits of fish in the schmear for the $3.69). I'm a dummy for not confirming the price beforehand, but this labeling is misleading.

$7.75 for maybe a 2 or 3 strips of mediocre quality salmon w cream cheese on a tasteless wheat bagel. This price isn't shown on on the menu, nor were any Noah's employees able to find the price on the menu. Their POS stations just pump out the price. 

Go elsewhere for this sort of breakfast bagel. Better yet, buy smoked salmon at the grocery for $7.75 and make yourself 5 lox & cream cheese bagels.
author: Marc R.

description:
If you like eating bagels that taste like the consistency of a sponge, come to Noah's bagel.

If you like bacon that tastes like cardboard paper poop, come to Noah's bagel.

If you like lettuce as limp as your grandpa's penis, come to Noah's bagel.

If you like eating trukey that tastes like it's been in pee water all day, come to Noah's bagel.

Come to Noah's bagel!
author: Thao L.

description: Good coffee, good food, great staff!!! They are super friendly and fast! We got a bagel sandwich and it was delicious! Great for eating on the go!
author: Shannon L.

description: Lots of variety, nice staff and they're smart to provide conveniently pre-selected bagel boxes to grab and run to work with. I understand no bagel in SF will ever match a New York bagel, so let's just agree the 5 stars is for a spectacular business model. The 5th star earns it's place because when I was craving a strawberry banana smoothie, surprisingly I can also get that here. Keep up the good work!
author: Nic E.

description: Worst experience EVER. There was 5 people in my group that ordered at least 8 bagels ALL of the bagels that we ordered (and were visible in the bakery case) were apparently unavailable. We were not told this until waiting for about 15 minutes. Then they got one of our orders wrong, when we informed them of this they said they would make a new one. We waited 5 more minutes, but it turns out they forgot to make it. Terrible terrible place, we'll seek out other bagel options going forward.
author: Alicia C.

description:
this is definitely the worst noah's i've been to. the service is poor and they couldn't pronounce my name for the life of them. 

i ordered a sour dough bagel with plain cream cheese. When i got my bagel, it wasn't even wrapped in it's bag or cut in half...i mean i'm not asking for a lot but the noah's i've been to have at least been able to do what they're suppose to do. this is a chain, there needs to be consistency.

i also asked for it to be TOASTED. not only was it NOT toasted, it tasted day old. and they totally cheated me on the cream cheese. wtf. so dis-a-ppoint-ed.
author: Andy H.

description:
This location is awful!

It wasn't that bad before I feel like it's gone down hill in recent months.

First of all, expect at least a 10-15 minute wait for a simple order of a bagel. I always get non-toasted too and it takes that long.

Then after waiting for that long, they tell me they're out of the blueberry bagels I had already paid for. When I got upset, they back pedaled and said they have some.  So I expected freshly baked ones right out of the oven right?  WRONG.  It was just cold and stale.

The bagels are always stale, and just sooooo not edible.  I know that fresh bagels at Noah's other locations are really nice and soft and chewy.  I feel like this place always gives me a day old bagel.  

Not going back there until I see improvement.
author: Val S.

description:
We just ordered 2 bagels, toasted with avocado, and tomatoes..... Great, right?

NOT.

The bagels were not toasted, and they were smushed. AND.....the avocado was frozen.....????

Thanks but no thanks.
author: Brooke W.

description:
I'm from the land of Bruegger's -- so, admittedly, I have a bias -- but two and a half stars? Seriously? What exactly are you expecting from an inexpensive bagel / sandwich place? Sheesh...some of these reviews are ridiculous. 

That said, the bagels are not the best I have had -- but they're not bad (you can't really ruin a bagel, you know?). I particularly love their cream cheeses, which are whipped; they're fantastic. I just bought a container of pumpkin cream cheese, and when that is out of season, strawberry is my go-to. They are not as heavy as regular cream cheese -- and I actually prefer them. All in all, not bad -- honestly!
author: Katie M.

description: Service is really slow and you need to check your order before you leave.  Just today I saw them call up 2 people at the same time - recipe for disaster as they handed each person the wrong bag.  The persons were smart enough to check the bag and realized it was the wrong one and switched.  and the person in front of them ordered a schmear in the bagel and they put the wrong one.  It is too bad that their lack of service is causing the franchise to suffer.
author: Bebe W.

description: I have been trying to like this location for seven years because of its convenient location. I get that they deal with a lot of people at once - the morning rush is no joke. But they get my order wrong 1 out of 3 times and 1 of those times it takes two tries or more to correct. Today they left me waiting for fifteen minutes. When I finally got someone to pay attention, they told me they didn't have the bagel I ordered. Which is fine. It was NOT fine that I waited fifteen minutes to find that out. They didn't even apologize. I will NEVER come back.
author: Elizabeth C.

description:
For a quick bagel fix, Noah's Bagels are a-ok

They don't come close to the bestest Bagel Street Cafe - but given I was not in P-town & have not stocked up on my beloved bagels lately, Noah's fit the bill just fine

Got the Asiago w/ Cream Cheese - nothing fancy

The bagel was not nearly as cheesy as Bagel Street's Asiago but it was flavorful & chewy like a good bagel should be

There was a mixture of previous cream cheeses from other bagel schmeers on my Plain Cream Cheese & I just hope there was no lox or other meaty bits mixed in.  Weird, tasting random flavors w/ each bite when it's all supposed to be p-l-a-i-n

Might be a good idea to swipe your blades clean between schmeers - or better yet, use 1 blade per schmeer??

Staff was super-friendly & they processed the line like nobody's business.  In & out like a snap!

Ratio of schmeer to bagel was decent & in need of another quick fix, I'd definitely come back to Noah's
author: Adrienne G.

description:
Noah's Bagels on Bush Street is their main downtown store.  Their store near Beale and Mission closed down, which was just as well, since they would mix my order.

The Bush Street store was crowded at lunchtime.  I made my order to a bored clerk that I wanted a Panini.  He asked what kind.  I said what do you have and he listed them.  I got the potato salad and the tuna Panini. 

To the cashier, nearly $8.00 poorer and then I waited.  While waiting I noted that though there were people furiously making sandwiches, the orders were not all that fast coming out.  Personally I waited nearly 15 minutes for my simple order. 

I noted that two of the clerks took a lunch break, which I thought odd since it was crowded before 1:00 pm.  

Sloppy Service:  One of the clerks was handing out an order with no bag.  The customer asked for a bag.  He then opened it for her and handed it to her!  A cashier looked like she was busily texting.  Hmmm. 

The sandwich finally arrived.  I noted that though the tuna with pickles and nice tomato were in the Panini, they were arranged so that part of the bread had some tuna and other parts I was just biting into mostly bread.  This should have been better arranged. 

Overall:  The clerks need better training on customer service.  You pack a person's order into a bag, include a few napkins and hand it to them.  Simple.  Not recommended due to the sloppy service and high prices.
author: James M.

description: The only reason I stop here is because it's on the way to work & could be convenient, but it really doesn't matter without service & a product. The ice machine is just taking up space in this small store, considering it never works every time I visit. I guess this location never serves iced coffee nor will they ever. The same young male cashier I see on Monday mornings does not greet people, he's not friendly, & he doesn't apologize that nothing works. Noah's Bagels might as well have robots as clerks - at least they could be programmed to greet people nor would they exude a vibe that they don't really want to work for Noah's Bagels. One time I got a bagel that had been written on with a permanent marker - so much for quality control. If you ever visit the location on Chestnut Street in Cow Hollow, you will see a HUGE difference - considering they actually remember your name at that location. The clerks there see you as a person rather than just a number and a dollar sign. I complained to guest services - they replied "thank you for the positive feedback" so I guess they don't really read your feedback. More $$$ for Starbuck's!
author: Jules F.

description:
I'm one of those weird people who has zero desire to eat a bagel unless someone else slices it and cream cheeses it up for me.  If I ever go buy a bag of bagels and a tub of cream cheese at the supermarket, it'll grow moldy before I even eat one.

I'm actually not elitist when it comes to eating bagels.  I'll totally eat a $1 plain bagel with plain cream cheese.  But having said that, I do love Noah's for their delicious shmears.

This particular Noah's is on my way to work, and there's always a long line when I walk past around 8 am.  However, I decided to head to work a little later, and around 9:30 the line had died down, and there were only 2 or 3 people in front and back of me.  There's a system, though, when there are lines: they have people going around with those little portable machines to take your order, so all you have to do is get in line to pay, and then wait for your food.  Still, it will be quite awhile before your bagels come up.

Even when there's no line, you have to go to one register to order, and then shimmy down to the left to pay, and then stand back to wait.  I don't really understand why they do this though; I think it would be easier to open up 4 registers instead of 2 for ordering and 2 for paying.  But that's just me.

Yes, it's more expensive than your average mom and pop shop.  But the smoekd salmon shmear on a sesame bagel is totally worth it.  Oh, and let's not forget about the garlic & herb shmear on the poppyseed bagel.  I liked the salt bagels, but apparently they only have that at a few Noah's now.

Is it just me, or do carbs just taste more delicious than any other food group on earth?
author: Tori S.

description: I'm from NY, and I didn't try the bagels, but I stopped to pick up lunch one day and had the California Chicken Sandwich, which I thought was pretty delish. Service was alright. Took a little while longer than expected for them to make my sandwich but I didnt care, it was fresh and tasted good! Reasonably priced as well.
author: Jenny C.

description:
Secret Noah's.

Just out off the radar from my office. Excellent hide out spot.

Always plenty of seating.

shhh, this is a secret.
author: V B.

description:
I didn't discover the secret upstairs eating area here for a couple years. It's a little warm upstairs, but perfect in the winter months.

I really like their tuna salad on a peppercorn potato bagel. It comes with a pickle spear and a cup of potato salad for about $5.
author: Kathleen M.

description: My favorite thing to order @ Noah's Bagels is the egg, cheddar, and bacon on a challah roll.  Yummmm.  Add some chives, butter, pepper, and salt, and you have a delicious lunch/snack.  Always consistent, and glad there are Noah's in the city!
author: Mel G.

description:
I used to go to Noah's quite often when they first expanded the franchise.  I've lapsed and settled for Costco's version of Noah's (oh the horror!).  Anyhoo, stopped by here for lunch today.  Ordered the italian chicken panini sandwich.  Eh, it was ok.  I do a better job with my own panini sandwich maker.  It's not horrible but it's not the best either.

Service was pretty good.  They made sure I picked up my chips before I ran outta there (doh, I didn't know I had to pick up the chips myself.  How come they're not in my bag?)...
author: Wendy H.

description:
The one star is for the Bagels being decent and the pricing is "alright". 
I've given this location a few trys and i'm done.
The reason things take forever is because the people behind the counter do not give a shit about their jobs. 
they are lazy. 
they simply just don't care.
why am i getting attitude and being rushed when i'm the only person in line? 
why is my simple bagel taking forever?
and why was i not informed that there were no more thin bagels. that defeats the purpose of ordering the thin bagels. the cashierist failed to mention that to me and just put it on a plain bagel. on top of that she was rude and seriously a drag.
author: Reasonable Y.

description: Good lawd! First of all, this place is a mad house on a Friday morning. All they had left at 9am was blueberry, cinnamon raisin or chocolate chip -- and this was communicated after I ordered 2 veggie egg sandwiches. Blueberry, egg and mushrooms? No thank you. Secondly, the employees here YELL at the customers. Maybe I just haven't had my coffee yet, but it seems a little early to be so loud! My sandwiches ended up soggy, and the bagels are mediocre. Glad I used a gift card for my purchase, and not my own money!
author: Emily B.

description: Worst noahs ever.  I used to love going  to noahs every day when I lived in Seattle.  They had great iced tea,  nice people,  and of course good bagels. This place is horrific.  I had to dump the tea,  the people are sort of nice but ineffective and the place is dirty.  I will not be back.
author: Becky T.

description:
Noah's! this is our spot! i luv coming here after a long day shopping down town w the girlie's. 

first :go next door to the jamba juice, get a matcha green tea smoothie

next: come to Noah's get a bagel w/ cream cheese

Last: go upstairs sit back an relax as u watch people from their balcony.


**You gotta have something to drink  w ur bagel or your gonna end up chocking from the dryness!
beware!
author: Isabella T.

description: Too packed, bagels are not good, expensive. Mehhh.
author: Andrew K.

description:
Noah's, you are SO not New York.

I just paid almost 6 bucks for:
a toasted bagel ($1) + avocado ($1) + lox ($4)

When I got to the register, I had a slight moment of sticker shock. But I said to myself, okay, I know avocados are expensive and so is smoked salmon. So, whatever.

Well, I trekked to the orifice, in the rain, got to my desk and opened the bag. DISAPPOINTMENT! First, the bagel was NOT toasted. And it tasted stale. Second, if I'm going to pay $5 for toppings, I WANT SOME FREAKING TOPPINGS!! The amount of both avocado and salmon that was put on my bagel was insulting. If I had paid one dollar, I would have overpaid.

If my office wasn't so far and it hadn't been raining, I would have marched back over there and gotten my money back.
