Noah's is a rip-off---AND the bagels are mediocre. Save your money and eat out of the garbage can.
author: Shannon R.

description:
The bottom line is that this place should be shut down but it won't because Noah's makes enough money catering to business. Luis the manager should be fired for allowing some of the nasty and disgusting behavior occur here. I have been here over a dozen times and have always experienced incompetence, and horrible customer service. Perhaps if I spoke spanish.......as it seems everyone in there is Mexican.
But let's talk about their attitudes. I have overheard (in spanish of course) the obese Mexican man always there in the am doing deliveries say some horrendous things about female customers. Total lack of respect. Too many mexicans and too much spanish speaking there. The other clowns who work should be lucky to be employed as they seem like candidates for welfare. I waited almost 10 minutes for a bagel that wasnt toasted and looks like they "sprayed" a butter mist on the bagel for 1.75. Go to Lee's deli down the block for a better bagel and service. These people really suck!
author: Michael A.

description: Walked in, got in line, saw dead roach behind door, got out line, left store.  This may be the last time I go here...
author: Steve B.

description: Awful service, especially in the mornings when staff would rather gossip than finish taking your order. Too loud- had to keep repeating myself to customize my bakers dozen. This place isn't well stocked either. Been here twice in a month as the other locations in the FiDi have closed. They should have worked on improving their coffee and kept the nicer staffed one on Howard street as I won't be coming back to this location in a hurry
author: s y.

description:
average with average service.

i went at 10am and they were out of mostly all the bagels and showed no enthusiasm or smiled once during the interaction. i dont like bad service, and i remember it was pretty crappy... the bagel was good. fresh, but i wouldnt make it my routine to come here...

i woulda given it 1 star if the bagel wasnt so good.
author: Ava M.

description:
Total waste of calories.

Part of me knew better than to stop in a bagel chain touting NY style anything, but I just couldn't help it. I had a bizarre bagel craving.

The bagels looked fake and bland when I walked in and when I opened up my order (whole wheat w/light cream cheese) I had to resist the urge to toss it. My 'bagel' was not a bagel at all. It was a poor attempt at a bagel. It had the texture of a Thomas' bagel you pick up at the grocery store, but pricier. Are you kidding me? Slice of bread with a hole. Fired.
author: Karena Q.

description:
Is it too hard to get a bagel done right? I am not even talking about the quality of the bagels themselves. All I ask of for is a bagel toasted dark light on the butter.

They always ask me more than once and repeat the order to me. I also see them mark it on their sheets! Yet when I get my bagel it is barely warm and dripping with butter. What is the point of asking if you aren't going to make the order anyway? On top of that they can't get my name right. I not only repeat it 4-5 times.. but when I just spell it for them they still don't write it correctly or get offended when I try to spell it - cutting me off saying "I got it". 

Well guess what you don't! Not only can you not make a decent bagel with simple instruction - but it seems that you don't know the alphabet either.
author: Angelito R.

description: I'm not a bagel connoisseur, but these bagels are definitely better than the Safeway brand ones that I usually buy! I come here once in a great while because it's right next to my job, but the toasted chocolate chip bagel never fails! It's always quick service too!
author: Junel S.

description: Great tasty bagels and the price wont break your piggy bank. Coffee could be better, they might think of teaming up with another company to compliment their bagels.
author: Jova E.

description:
This place blows.

I tried to order a lox and cream cheese bagel. It's on the menu, lower left corner. It's priced at $4.85. I could not get the idiot behind the counter to ring me up for that item. I pointed to it on the menu. It took several minutes to convince him the store had the item. There was even a package of lox right in front of me so I knew they had it in stock.

When I tried to pay for it from the manager, she told it it would be $8.99. I asked how it went from $4.85 to $9.00. She quoted back my order. It was the exact same thing that was on the menu for $4.85. I am not sure why I could not get a bagel, which I assume they stock, cream cheese, which I saw containers laying about and lox, but it was beyond the capability of the manager or her idiot staff to sell me either item, so I went to Lee's Deli instead.

At the time they were cleaning behind the mobile prep station and it was dirty beyond belief. I have no idea how they scored a 90 on their last inspection, but I will not be visiting this terrible chain store. When service is so bad I cannot get served because the idiots working there are incapable of ringing me up for an straight order for something on their menu, I shudder to think how bad the product must be if I was ever served.
author: Peter G.

description: The last 3 times I have visited this Noah's they have managed to mess up my order. The first 2 times, I asked for my bagel well-toasted, but it came out under toasted. Plus they put the tiniest amount of cream cheese on it. Not even a tablespoon - It should at least cover the bagel! I went again this morning and ordered a bacon and spinach breakfast Panini, and they forgot the bacon (which I didn't notice until after I got to work and started eating it). For $5.50, I want my bacon. The staff is friendly but they are slow and just don't seem to know how to get orders right. It's too bad since I generally like Noah's and have better experiences at other locations.
author: A. S.

description:
i'm a huge fan of einstein's bagels, particularly their pumpkin offerings come fall. so when i moved to SF and found Noah's -- same company as einsteins -- i couldn't wait to try their pumpkin bagel + pumpkin schemer ($2.75). 

though i didn't have a problem with the service, detached but not rude -- all you can ask of a quick joint -- the person who toasted my bagel, toasted the shit out of it. the entire edge around both sides of my bagel were black. it was inedible. i threw half of it away and i am not one to throw away food.

too bad i had grabbed it on the go and was halfway to my destination before realizing it was so burnt. otherwise i would have asked for another. 

i suppose you could say 'lightly toasted' when you order, but still, why would anyone want a burned bagel. this was a case of neglect for your product. way to treat your paying customers, noah.
author: Melissa N.

description: I am always pleased you have the option to buy thin bagels to cut down on the calories.  This particular Noah's has great seating upstairs.  The staff is really nice too.
author: Ana C.

description: Chelsea coffee is my fab regular coffee in the city, and they are extra friendly at this location , bagels are tasty and fresh, and they also have thin bagels now :)
author: Karen P.

description:
Yes, service can be awkward, and yes, they have a tendency to creatively change your order, but when it comes to their lunch special, it's quite good.  Their lunch combo includes a deli sandwich, a side dish and a pickle for under $10.  My personal favorite is their tuna salad sandwich on an everything bagel.  I'm also a fan of their upstairs seating area which is especially cozy on a cold day.  

Drawbacks - the bathroom is in a building next door, they don't always follow orders to a T and if you need something special it can be hard to get the workers attention.
author: Ixchel F.

description: Fast service, no line at 8:30am on a Friday, warm and tasty bagel. Nice refrigerated section with Simply Apple, Simply Orange, smoothies, yogurts,orange juice, lemonade etc.  The blueberry lemonade also looked crackin', although I did not notice it untiI l I got to the register. Satisfied with my experience and would come again.
author: Adele Z.

description:
I' m sure that a monkey would be able to make a tastier bagel than the folks working there. This has been the worst experience  ever.  Person on food prep is terrible, and the manager simply rude.
Taste rating:  zero
Presentation :Zero
Customer Service: zero....
author: Linda S.

description: I really like this Noah's. It has a lot of seating (for a Noah's), there's an upstairs area away from the bustle of the streets (but if you sit by the railing, you'll get the smoke from the baking/cooking), helpful staff, and free wifi!!
author: Lana L.

description: I just care about my hot chocolate so dont ask me white or dark bcuz starbucks never asked me that question. But the coffee very berry cake here is better than starbucks. :))
author: Cloudy P.

description: I work around the corner from this place and pass by it every day, but I am tired of giving chance after chance after chance. The bagels are good, BUT the service and employees are terrible. I hate saying that, but even when there are "managers" around, the service was still pathetic. Slow, people getting their orders before me (even though i was there first), slow, rude. The latest was just yesterday when I entered reluctantly and ordered a toasted wheat seasame bagel with butter. They had only put butter on one side and when I turned around and mentioned this, the rude, smart-mouthed girl said, "no, there is butter on both sides". Oh, I'm sorry, is it me or you who's eating this. Just plain rude.
author: Amanda P.

description:
I remember back in the days of my college internship, coming here every morning, ordering 2 plain bagels hot out of the oven and off I went to the bank to start my day. Little did I know, or think about, the number of calories I should not have been ingesting before 9AM in the morning. I guess that's where the college weight comes from!

While I no longer come here everyday after starting my job in the city, I do enjoy my Noah's bagels every once in a while. When I do stop by, the wait was pretty short and I got what I ordered. Granted, I've never ordering anything but a simple bagel, toasted, and maybe some cream cheese. 

Stop on by if you're around.
author: Kitty N.

description: I'm not gonna lie, I keep coming back, not cuz the bagels are amazing more because it is just convenient and I crave bagels .   As long as I get the gourmet expensive jalepeno bagel I am always happy.  However if I stray off and get something different I never seem to be very satisfied.  The sandwiches are ok, but again I always have to play it safe and just get a turkey bagelwich, which really is a boring concept.  I always know if I am gonna go here I am gonna get the same exact thing everytime and never explore anything different because being disappointed more times than one sucks.
author: Rebecca D.

description:
Bagel-haters go home! 

I like bagels...  I like good schmear...
Give me Everything or nothing,
Noah am so glad you are so near.

I want blueberry and salmon
I want onion and cheese
a bakers dozen for the office...
a hero's welcome i receive.
author: Jim W.

description: Umm... nobody working at this location is alive.  It is kind of creepy too, b/c they are all moving around like they have a pulse (I think), but brain activity read is zero!!!!  They have not one single time got my order right, and guess what?  I don't even order anything unusual, just simply right there on their menu with no bells or whistles.... Not once has it been remotely close to the order.  I really just kept going back b/c for awhile it was my cheap and rushed lunch option, and I really love their stuff, but I eventually snapped.  It bothers me to even walk by at this point.  Hopeless in there I tell you...
author: Sarah E.

description:
Attention: ADMINISTRATIVE ASSISTANTS, OFFICE MANAGERS, OFFICE COORDINATORS, RECEPTIONIST

Unless you want to look incompetent or like an ass in front of your CEO, CMO, your top Sales Guy and their highly important clients, DO NOT ORDER FROM NOAH'S!

This morning is the second time I've been made to look like I can't handle the simple task of ordering bagels. I called on Monday and placed a very simple order: Bagel and Muffin Nosh Box and Odwalla OJ to be delivered today at 7:30 am no later than 7:45 am. Get this, I placed my order with the "Mgr" Louis! Hahah, I know right... 

Can you ladies guess what wasn't delivered when I got in this morning...... That's right, my f-ing order wasn't delivered.  And when I walked by the conference room all eyes were on me and not because I look cute. I called Louis the "Mgr" to find out what was going on and he said, listen to this... he said HE DIDN'T HAVE MY ORDER! I wanted to explode, this is the SECOND time this has happened. WTF is going on in Bagelland that you can't keep track of your orders you f-ing idiot. I didn't tell him that, I told him that this is the second time they've done this, and they are making me look extremely bad. So, he apologizes (at this point i really don't care for an apology I just want the food for the these hungry execs) and sends our order out...

The delivery guy gets here by 8:45 am, a whole hour they've waited, and he brings some generic OJ and not the Odwalla I ordered. WTF! WTF! WTF! He apologizes for the mistake, and I'm like you guys are full of mistakes. Also, I notice that they still had the audacity to charge me a $15 delivery charge (you bet I requested to have that removed)

I will NEVER order from Noah's again. Never. 

If you guys want delicious food, that is delivered ON TIME EVERYTIME, order from SPECIALTY'S 1-877-502-2837. I have nothing but praise for them.

Office Coordinator in The City
author: Eclectic C.

description: My first visit to this place, my normal morning rush. Great  bagel/egg sandwich..warm, toasted..yummy. Friendly staff and a nice surprise " fresh orange juice" ..I would recommend and would return
author: Anita T.

description:
Dear Noah

A plain bagel is not covered in poppy seeds. If I get drug tested and fail, it's 100% your fault. Asshole.

P.S. I only like you when I'm hungover and too lazy to walk to Katz's.
author: Suge K.

description:
Fancy bagels are a luxury. 

Came here a few times with my co-worker for a walk away from the office and get some grub. To me I think Noah's is just overrated bagels. Sure they taste good because anything taste good in the morning, well for me anyway. Yet, the couple times I have gone, our order took forever and they always run out of bagels at 9AM! I agree with the other reviews for the price you pay, in the end its still a bagel.
author: Jamie L.

description: This location of Noah's Bagels in particular is a good hub for in between appointments.  I can hop on the iPad and do a bit of work while eating a good bagel or sandwich. The seating upstairs is always quiet and they leave you alone.
author: Marty W.

description:
I grew up with one of the original founders of Noah's kids. He was a pain in the ass and so is this location. Imagine irritable, still-hungover-from-the-weekend fidi robots walking frenzied circles around one another at 8 a.m. on a Monday morning, desperately trying to figure out how the order/pickup/pay system actually works around here. Guess what? It doesn't work! It's all a big joke. It's like an exercise in utter senselessness. NO ONE knows what's going on.

However, if you didn't drink last night and you managed to take a shower and your head isn't fuzzy and you feel up to the challenge, you can get in and out of here in under 10 minutes (barely) if you're feeling assertive. I would never even bother with Noah's except for those staff meeting emergencies, when bulk coffee and bagels are an absolute necessity. All in all, the place isn't terrible. It's just not my first (or second...or third...) choice for coffee and a morning pick-me-up.
author: Autumn K.

description:
Sigh... the search for a decent bagel in San Francisco continues.  I came here this morning for a "fast" breakfast, because really, how long does it take to toast a bagel, butter it, and grab a cup of coffee?  Apparently, it takes a good 10 minutes, even wih the staff going full-speed.  And of course, there's like 20 other people waiting there with you so you're certainly not lacking for company.

As for what I ordered, the sundried tomato bagel was okay.  The sundried tomato chunks can be vexingly chewy, but overall, there was good flavor.  Unfortunately, my bagel was under-toasted and over-buttered (the exact opposite of how I asked for it), but it made for a filling breakfast.

Next time I'm in the area, I'm heading over to John's or the donut place next door for breakfast.  I'm only coming back to Noah's if the line doesn't snake out the door like it did today.  Plus, charging over $2 for a bagel with schmear seems a little ridiculous when the bagel itself is only 95 cents.
author: Angela H.

description: Great for a quick morning breakfast. I ordered the Bacon Egg Wrap (grand total $6), which is really a Breakfast Burrito, and it was pretty tasty. I like that you order on one end and pay on the other. Keeps the line moving quickly. The manager is very polite and the food is pretty good. I had a bad experience at the other Noah's by the Ferry Building (NOT a fan of that location b/c of some rude employees), but maybe caught them on a bad day...anyway, 4 stars for this one because of speedy service and smiles :)
author: Lauren Q.

description:
Look!

Steam!




Eating the said steam was proving to be more difficult than anticipated, and I was already late for work. I had to settle for a bagel, which was "eh."

Stupid steam.
author: Matthew R.

description:
I have resisted giving Noah's at Bush/Battery a review for a long time. I have never witnessed a less organized zoo of confused employees in my life. I went with a friend a few days ago and warn him that his order would be much different that what he requested. 

If you were a gambler or a bookie this would be one place where you could place bets and know that your risk was limited.

Pass on Noah's at this location.
author: Steve S.

description:
I'm not altogether crazy about Noah's anyway, but this location seems to be the worse by far.  It seems to be perennially short-staffed, which leads to a pretty chaotic morning scene.   The bagels are also poorly cooked/steamed/whatever.  They are hugely puffy, and not very tasty at all.

And I don't think a half pint of light cream cheese should cost $3.99.

Bite me, Noah's.
author: .Hon H.

description:
This Noah's Bagels location is my favorite place to go in the mornings, if I need to grab breakfast on the way to work, since I work nearby. The staff is friendly, and I've never had any issues with my food. I love the Turkey Sausage and Cheddar sandwich. They have a wide variety of bagels, some I never plan on eating (lol) but I think it's still cool nonetheless. Their prices can be a little up there, but I think it's definitely worth it.

Thank you Noah's Bagels for your outstanding service and delicious bagels! I heart you.
author: Danielle S.

description:
I come here often for event catering, and if I want a kickass deli style sandwich for lunch.

Why did they deserve 5 stars? I recently had to cancel half my pre paid catering order due to change in events. Noah's on Bush St was not only able to accommodate this fairly large last minute cancellation, they also gave me credit note for the portion returned. 

For that alone... Luis, Tammy and co... thank you for feeding me and the team!!
author: Joyce L.

description:
Noah's has bagels.  They are not bad bagels despite what you've heard from other yelpers.  However, they are not fantastic bagels.  

They do give you a lot of cream cheese or if you decide to order a "schmear" or whatever it is called.  Personally, I keep it basic and it works just fine for me.  I also like their cracked peppercorn bagel.

Their Mit sandwiches are ok too.  

I've never had any problems waiting for a long time for a bagel, and the staff has been consistently courteous to me on the numerous occasions I've been here.
author: Matthew H.

description:
Today I ordered my bagel extra toasted after remembering how barely warm it was the last time I ordered it toasted.  I described how I wanted the surface to be a bit brown and have some crunch to it, you know, like toast.  The person behind the counter seemed to grasp what I was saying, but yet once again the fluffy dinner roll that Noah's calls a bagel and for which they charge me $2.49 (really?  $1.50 for a schmear of cream cheese?) comes to me slightly warmed.  

I'm done with this place.  I've tolerated the not particularly tasty coffee when my office buys a few containers for meetings.  I even got over the near $8 cost for the breakfast sandwich I ordered once ($8 and it didn't even have egg!).  But come on, toast my bagel.  Brown.  Crunch.  Toast.
author: Mikey P.

description: I feel totally cheated. Why on earth would you show fresh avocado chunks on all of the bagels in your displays, charge me an extra dollar, and give me a bagel with runny "avocado" sauce. Disgusting. I have never really liked Noah's, but this is the final straw.
author: Annie C.

description:
Can we talk about the bagel situation in this city? Nothing chaps the inner Jewish New Yorker like schlepping over to Noah's for a quick lunch and then standing around for 15 minutes while they "prepare" my bagel. Christ on the cross, Noah's! Toast it, slap some cream cheese on it and call it a damn day. Oy and what is with the cutting in half?!

And why can't I get a bagel after 3pm in this city? I'll tell you why, because not enough people are complaining. 

But in the spirit of being proactive AND open source, I will freely share the secrets to a successful bagel biz AS LONG as you open it near my house.  Step one- Go get one of those big dairy/meat/deli cases, the kind with clear glass on the front so that every schmendrick isn't touching the food, but we can see it. Very important- make sure the refridgeration works on the inside of the case.  Step two- Fill said case with cream cheese in different weights, white fish, chopped liver, lox, crazy flavors of cream cheese like bacon garlic and curry raisin and capers with anchovy. Whatever, go nuts! Just make sure it looks nice. Step three- serve bagels until at least 7pm in the evening. I don't care if they are boiled or steamed, if they aren't disgusting serve them ALL DAY. 

Now is that so hard? You can thank me with a free dozen once a month.
author: Krismet C.

description: I've given this place a try several times.  Most of the times, they disappoint.   Their asiago bagels are hard and does not seem fresh at all and this is at 7:30am in the morning.   The lines are long and I don't know why?   They servce mediocre bagels.
author: JD A.

description:
I know I shouldn't expect too much from a large conglomerate chain, but is it really so hard to make a good bagel with cream cheese?  Especially when I can make the same things at home for at least 1/3 of the price but don't because I'm busy in the mornings and don't have time?  I feel like Noah's goes out of its way to put itself in convenient locations and then intentionally puts no effort into its food to spite desperate customers on their way to work.  Ok, that's probably not true, but still.  I'm not complaining about the bready, not authentic, dry bagels.  All I want is to have them toasted well.  Apparently this is too much to ask.  The coffee shop down the street sometimes sells Noah's bagels and toasts them way better for the same price.  I think this morning's venture into a veggie egg ciabatta sandwich really ruined Noah's for me.  How can you go wrong with a combo of egg, mushrooms, spinach, tomato and cheese?  You can!!  If you're Noah's Bagels!  You don't put any salt in the food, so you end up with a dull, flat tasting egg and a sour tomato taste.  Horrible!  Even Subway seasons its sandwiches with salt, pepper and oil, and for way less of a price.  

Ugh.  I guess the point of this review is don't waste your money on the veggie egg sandwich.  I'll probably still go to the local Noah's out of desperation every once in a while because it's so convenient, but never again with the egg sandwiches.
author: Pearl L.

description:
For some reason I just cannot work out I always come to this Noah's whenever I am EXTREMELY hungover. They aren't good. Hey I'm Jewish and my Grandma's from New York so I know what a good bagel is... but whenever I come here I am just too dazed and confused from the previous night to care.

asiago bagel with cream cheese & lox - onions and capers
I may be hungover but at least I know how to order a bagel.
author: Sarah S.

description: Ehhhh I don't know what's up with this place.  I love their workers, every morning they are soo nice and helpful and their manager is really nice and cool so 2 stars for the workers, but -3 cause the place sucks.  I used to order every other morning from Noah's for me & my co-workers & I swear to you every time something was missing! Or some order was wrong! I now have to literally open up every bagel and check if it's the right one 'cause it gets tiring walking bag for a stupid bagel every time especially in the rain! Also, very disappointed in their breakfast ciabatta because the bacon is disgusting it even looks gross.  I guess it's microwaved or something, but swear to you it looks so bad you'd think you'd get sick from eating it.  So yeaaa save yourself, grab a Jamba!
author: Christina O.

description: Decent creamcheese but a wretched bagel! Better off going to safeway; a true disgrace to the gloriousness that is the bagel. The search continues for a decent bagel in downtown SFO. For now, the best option is Posh.
author: Dave N.

description:
I like how this place is a few blocks from where I live, thus I can get my Noahs fix now and then. However I dont like when I say "just a little cream cheese pleaseee" and they give me a huge slab of cream cheese. 

Well, Amanda, why dont you ask for it on the side, you ask? Tried it. They give you a tiny container and I use maybe half of it for my bagel and feel bad throwing the rest away.

Staff is always friendly, even during peak hours when it's flooded with people. 

A bit steep for a bagel and juice. I think my total comes around to $5 or $6? meh.
author: Amanda S.

description: This Noah's is conveniently located in the Financial District. In the morning when I get off the express bus, it's a few blocks down. I get my box of bagels with salmon smear and I'm on my way to work. The wait is normally short due to the system they have going. They take the order at one end, pay at the register and then call your name when your order is ready. The bagels here are good. I like the texture and the flavor. The salmon smear goes great with the savory bagels. I get coupons in the mail every once in awhile for $4 off a bagel box with 13 bagels and 2 smears. So it's normally $13.99 but I spend $10 and split the box with a friend. It's a good deal.
author: Candace F.

description: Great service, with helpful suggestions to make our meal worthwhile. Large selection of bagels.
author: Colin K.

description: I used to come a lot a year and a half ago & ended up stopping because I saw someone go from sweeping to bagelmaking without handwashing. That being said things look better these days. Manager is really great & organized. Saw no sanitary concerns!
author: Jenna K.

description: I love  the Lox sandwich on a lightly toasted everything bagel with capers tomato, cucumber, cream cheese, and red onion.  It's the best.
author: D S.

description:
Not so impressive. The spicy chicken sandwich was indeed spicy, but I could have achieved the same effect at home with my bottle of Sriracha and saved the 8 bucks. 

Also, I hate seeing five (yes, FIVE) people who ordered after me get their food before me. If I had ordered a complicated sandwich, it might be excusable, but I didn't. So, diary, you tell me...
author: Krissy D.

description:
Couldn't help stopping by here one morning for one of their infamous bagels...I've had the bagels before but never been into an actual Noah's establishment. I ordered the whole wheat sesame one with cream cheese and it took a while for them toast my bagel for some reason. The bagels are quite pricey compared to other places where you can buy them (I think it was $2.40 for mine) but the cream cheese shmear is yummy! The bagel is HUGE too and definitely fills me up until lunch time.

I will come back here once in a while if I feel like overindulging on their gourmet bagels but I can't afford to make it a habit.
author: Karen Y.

description: I asked for a lox bagel sandwich and literally got a bagel with 3 slices of smoked salmon (which didn't even fill the entire bagel) and no cream cheese or any other ingredients.
author: S M.

description:
I've had good luck with the Noah's at Market by the Ferry Building.  I don't know what it is, but their bagels seem fresher than any other Noah's I've tried.  They are good for a solid simple bagel.

Keyword being good.  Dependable.  Not out of sight.
author: Jack H.

description:
I never go into Noah's expecting a world class bagel; it's a chain, I've been to a lot of their stores, and I only go here when I'm starving and in desperate need of carbs.  The way they handle their line may not be the most efficient ever but since I'm used to the Berkeley store, this is not too bad.

Why the two stars then?  Well they messed up my schmear.  Am I being too harsh?  Mistakes do happen but if you've ever tried an everything bagel with the honey almond schmear, you'd understand.  For those of you who haven't, just imagine eating onions/sesame seeds/etc. dipped in honey...

I apologize if I offend anyone that likes honey and onions.
author: Vi N.

description: The staff is very friendly. The bagel was the softest, freshest I have ever ate. The coffee drinks are great, especially considering they have sugarfree versions. An outstanding intro into the restaurants in San Francisco our first day in. We went to the one near Pier #1 and  the downtown area.
author: Jason M.

description:
We wanted a bagel sandwich - something hot and not too pricey because we were headed back to the apartment to eat it. "Noah's looks good" - the worst words spoken today. 
We walk in. We look at the menu. We make our selection. Then we go to order. I order a Pesto and Turkey sandwich. The messy looking girl behind the counter checks something on a ticket and asks what side I want - She tells me even though the menu says I can have fruit salad - I can't. Well, fine. Then my date orders a panini - he can't have one cause they close in AN HOUR and she turned the machine off. AN HOUR!!!!! Who starts closing more then an hour early!?!? 
Anyway, so we get our sandwiches after waiting in between GARBAGE BAGS that have been stacked by the door. One should note, there were at LEAST ten people still here. 
We take our food home - they made me a totally different sandwich than I ordered. I ordered Pesto Turkey and I got some kind of Turkey Club. 
This place sucks and I am never going back.
author: Jena D.

description:
I love bagel sandwiches, so when I saw Noah's Bagels I had to try one. I liked the bagel that I had, which was the turkey pesto on a whole wheat sesame bagel, but I think they may have forgotten the pesto...
Either way I thought the bagel was good, but I have had better bagel sandwiches. 

As for the customer service, the staff seemed a bit disorganized and it took awhile to get our food. We did beat the lunch rush; therefore we didn't have to stand in line for long, but it filled up quickly.
author: Carly W.

description: slim pickings for breakfast in the financial district, so this place sticks out almost by default. got a decent tasting bagel and coffee for a decent price. lots of cream cheese options. not mind blowing, but not sure this place deserves all the hate!
author: Dave L.

description:
this is the strangest noah's in san francisco.  about three different parts of our order (bagel and one of those mini-cake things...not so complicated) were wrong, and the coffee is truly terrible.  everyone who works there seems bemused, though not unkind, so two stars and not one.  but even my bagel didn't taste awesome.  maybe i've been in new york too much to appreciate the lackadaisical noah's bagel experience, but still...don't hit this one up if you can manage it.  

also, it is my imagination, or is it totally overpriced?
author: Alanna C.

description:
This is the Noah Bagels just down the office. I hope I never eat here, I have been doing it for way too long in Corvallis. So mixed review: I dont want to eat there + it has been useful for me. 

Anyway, the whole point of this review is to check the review on Strands, I just added the feed
author: Gabriel A.

description: The food is okay, and it's very conveniently located between my gym and my office.  But they get my order wrong too frequently, and the other day I went in and one of the employees was mopping the floor from a big bucket of really disgusting black water, then she put the mop down and went and filled my order.  She washed her hands, but I still should have walked out.  I don't think I'll go back again.
author: Lisa B.

description: Our members at Planet Fitness get free bagels the 2nd Tuesday of every month and we like Noah's. The deliver at 5 in the morning when we open!!!! The fat free cream cheeses are awesome!!!!
author: Stella R.

description: I believe I've made it clear that I LOVE it when women call me "honey." Well, a sweet bird @ this particular bagelry calls me honey after every question ... and she asks a LOT of them. "You want that toasted, honey?" "You want a nice pappy-shmear on that, honey?" "You want some coffee with that, honey?" "Ooooh, from the look on your face, I take it you don't like coffee, do you, honey?" My face was right -- I don't like coffee at all -- but I like Noah's okay (Cracked Peppercorn or Asiago, NOT toasted + Garden Veggie spread = yum), and I ADORE the "honey" lady.
author: Gregor G.

description:
I stop by Noah's when I want a toasted bagel, sugar cookie, or pumpkin muffin (only in the fall, but they are amazing). Usually runs about $3 total.

However as a lunch place, it's pretty expensive for their sandwiches and salads. Usually, $8 plus, which is not a good value compared to some other places you can get lunch in the FiDi (Good Eats, Hi Tea, Chipotle are all right around the corner).

Plus -- Most people don't realize it has an upstairs seating area, so you can always get a seat. Nice and quiet up there.
author: Bea G.

description:
Stopped coming here a few years ago. The reason?

An employee came in hauling a dirty looking trash can he had emptied somewhere, set it down, and then picked up my bagel and started putting cream cheese on it. No hand wash, no gloves, nothing. I walked out and haven't been back since.

Seriously guys? That's just gross. 

Something to think about next time some dude is spreading cream cheese on your bagel....
author: J B.

description:
careful in the mornings.. the lines can get pretty outrageous..
i love all their bagels... 
especially their eggmits..

everything bagels.. cracked peppercorn potato.. asiago.. 
and their gourmet bagels?? wow..
really good!!
author: monica c.

description: One of two conveniently located Noah's in the area.  People there are pretty cool.  And there are actual tables upstairs if you prefer to hide and eat outside the office instead of at your desk, although I haven't done that in over two years now.
author: spiff e.

description:
Noah's has changed their "recipe" for their "SUPER ONION" bagels without, to my knowledge, advising their customers of the change.     These now contain NO poppy seeds, which are an integral component of the recipe. These bagels are NOT super any more.  
If Noah's intends to make other clandestine changes to their tried and true offerings, BEWARE!
author: Phil H.

description: The bagel was okay. The hummus was the worst I've ever had. I guess nobody told them you're supposed to chop up the chick peas. First and last visit for me.
author: aaron f.

description: Just because it looks like a bagel, talks like a bagel does not make it a bagel.  Noah's has something I call a BLO, a Bagel-Like Object, I like a bagel that is not round in shape but has the consistency of a chewy and ethereal New York bagel.  I go here when I need an a.m. carb fix but I do not come here for the BLOs.
author: Jaime Patricio M.

description: Eh, is ok. A little over processed to be NY Style. They have yummy joo food though.
author: Colleen B.

description: There's a better Noah's on fremont street. It's just a block away. For some reason this Noah's always manage to mess up my order. I wanted eggmit bagel with swiss, mushroom, and spinach. Where's the mushroom?? Last time they forgot to put in the spinach. It's not that hard to mix 3 ingredients in a bowl and put it in a microwave.
author: Ari C.

description: I am from the east coast.  My parents are Brooklyn Jews.  I know a good bagel when I see one.  However, maybe I have been living in SF for too long, but I don't think that Noah's Bagels is too bad.  The bagel is fresh, the cream cheese is plentiful, and it makes me happy.
author: Joanna S.

description: Tasty and easy, yes, but so not worth the money.  There is one thing that keeps me coming back for more though...the shmear!  If I'm going to put badness in my body it damn well better be tasty.  I always go for the blueberry or honey-almond shmear.  Still overpriced, but oh, so sweet!  Stay away from me, savory bagels!
author: Krystle S.

description: I'm convinced they put something in the bagels.  Once in your stomach and mixed with a beverage of your choice, the bagels expands in your stomach.  You won't be hungry for hours.
author: Jon P.

description: Bagels are edible, but not the best ever, for when you are in a bagel-ly mood. The price is way high if you want cream cheese or anything on your bagel and they are way slow.
author: Wendy M.

description: I typically don't frequent this location because I have a closer one to my job.  Today I had to go to Embarcadero 1 and passed this one by.  I decided I would try one of their open faced melts and yummo, glad I did.  I had the pastrami and swiss on a pumpernickel bagel.  They toast it with the meat, cheese and tomato and it comes out crunchy and cheesy, so very good.  I went with the potato salad cause I've tried their cole slaw and that sucked.  It also came with a dill pickle.  The only negative is the price, almost $8!
author: La C.

description:
That's it. 

I have totally had it with you, Noah. 

It is wholly unacceptable to:

(1) Ask me to repeat my order 4 times for the bagel jockey, a wholesome if clueless seeming young man, when all I asked for is a BAGEL WITH EGG AND CHEESE. "Yes, an Egg Mitt with Cheese.  And yes, please toast it, and toast it dark." I watched him slowly circle all the right things -- egg mitt, cheese, salt and pepper, toasted/ DK. 

(2) FAIL TO PUT THE CHEESE ON THE BAGEL

(3) FAIL TO TOAST THE BAGEL

I considered walking back over and throwing at you my soggy, tasteless egg on a limp bagel. When I told my friend this story, she wrote: "hey, you'd be doing it for all of us! thwarted bagel eaters, unite!"

We'll be the two out front with picket signs next week.
author: Celeste L.

description: i love noah's. love, love, love. so why only one freakin star? well, why the ef are they out of coffee every saturday morning? wtf?? i mean get with the program guys. keep the chelsea pot full.
author: Janet G.
